Package org.reldb.wrapd.sqldb

Class SQLTypeGenerator

java.lang.Object
org.reldb.wrapd.sqldb.SQLTypeGenerator
Direct Known Subclasses:
QueryTypeGenerator, UpdateTypeGenerator, ValueOfTypeGenerator
public abstract class SQLTypeGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
Generates Java code to represent a SQL construct.

  • Constructor Details

    • SQLTypeGenerator

      public SQLTypeGenerator​(java.lang.String dir, java.lang.String packageSpec, java.lang.String queryName, java.lang.String sqlText, java.lang.Object... args)
      Create a generator of compiled update invokers.
      Parameters:
      dir - Directory into which generated class(es) will be put.
      packageSpec - Package to which generated class(es) belong, in dotted notation.
      queryName - Name of generated query class.
      sqlText - SQL query text. Parameters may be specified as ? or {name}. If {name} is used, it will appear as a corresponding Java method name. If ? is used, it will be named pn, where n is a unique number in the given definition. Use getSQLText() after generate() to obtain final SQL query text with all {name} converted to ? for subsequent evaluation.
      args - Sample arguments.

  • Method Details

    • destroy

      public static boolean destroy​(java.lang.String dir, java.lang.String packageSpec, java.lang.String className)
      Delete this SQL construct type.
      Parameters:
      dir - The directory containing the query definition.
      packageSpec - Package to which generated class(es) belong, in dotted notation.
      className - The class name of the query definition.
      Returns:
      boolean true if definition successfully deleted.

    • getSQLText

      public java.lang.String getSQLText()
      Get SQL text. May be modified by generate().
      Returns:
      SQL text.

    • getQueryName

      protected java.lang.String getQueryName()
      Get query name.
      Returns:
      Query name.

    • getPackageSpec

      protected java.lang.String getPackageSpec()
      Get package specification.
      Returns:
      Package specification.

    • hasArgs

      protected boolean hasArgs()
      Return true if arguments have been specified.
      Returns:
      True if arguments have been specified.

    • getParameterList

      protected java.util.List<Attribute> getParameterList​(boolean withDatabase, boolean withConnection)
      Obtain the declared parameter list, with optional additional Database and Connection parameters.
      Parameters:
      withDatabase - If true, include 'Database database' before the declared parameters.
      withConnection - If true, include 'Connection connection' before the declared parameters.
      Returns:
      The parameters.

    • getParameterDefinitionListString

      protected java.lang.String getParameterDefinitionListString​(boolean withConnection)
      Return a parameter list specification string.
      Parameters:
      withConnection - True to include "Connection connection" parameter.
      Returns:
      Parameter list definition string.

    • getDeclaredQueryParameterNameListString

      protected java.lang.String getDeclaredQueryParameterNameListString()
      Return a parameter list reference string. E.g., if the parameter definition string is "int x, String y", the parameter list reference string is "x, y". This is just the declared query parameters, not additional parameters like Database or Connection.
      Returns:
      Parameter list reference string.

    • getDefinitionSourceCode

      protected abstract java.lang.String getDefinitionSourceCode()
      Obtain the Java text for this definition.
      Returns:
      Query text.

    • addMethod

      protected void addMethod​(SQLTypeGenerator.Method method)
      Add a method to the list of methods defined in the generated Java and that may be used by external mechanisms.
      Parameters:
      method - Method being added.

    • getMethods

      public java.util.Collection<SQLTypeGenerator.Method> getMethods()
      Get a collection of methods defined in the generated Java that may be used by external mechanisms.
      Returns:
      Collection of methods.

    • generate

      public java.io.File generate()
      Generate this query type as a Java class definition.
      Returns:
      The generated Java source file.
